meanings.definition: A type of cell that engulfs and absorbs foreign particles, such as bacteria or dead cells.
meanings.sent1: The phagocyte in the body helps fight off harmful bacteria.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how phagocytes work to keep us healthy.
meanings.sent3: The phagocyte was so busy eating bacteria, it forgot to take a break.
meanings.sent4: The phagocyte acted like a tiny vacuum cleaner, sucking up all the germs.
meanings.sent5: Imagine phagocytes as tiny Pac-Man cells gobbling up invaders.

meanings.definition: To engulf and absorb foreign particles, such as bacteria or dead cells.
meanings.sent1: White blood cells phagocyte harmful substances to protect the body.
meanings.sent2: The immune system uses phagocytosis to remove unwanted particles.
meanings.sent3: The soap phagocytes dirt from your hands, leaving them clean.
meanings.sent4: The city's cleanup crew phagocytosed all the trash on the streets.
meanings.sent5: The vacuum cleaner phagocytosed all the crumbs on the carpet.
